poem:
Title: A Marooned Paradise

Suriname, the shaded universe untamed,
Where Green reigns supreme, a thorny crown.
But beneath, a danse macabre is unframed,
Gold-grains eroding, roots plucked from ground.

Timber falls, echo a resounding sorrow,
Deep tribal songs, now muffled by greed.
Oh, what a hollow legacy we borrow,
Paradise stolen for some fleeting need.
